author: Shoumojit Banerjee
text:
Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar, who was admitted to the city’s Ruby Hall Clinic last week after he complained of exhaustion, was discharged on Wednesday and was said to be in good health by doctors.

Mr.Pawar left for Mumbai soon after his discharge. Doctors said that all his physical parameters were normal.

The 75-year-old politician spent three days in the hospital amid a swirl of rumours doing the rounds on the social media that posited Mr.Pawar as being “in an extremely serious medical condition”.

“I have tours lined up for the next two months without a single day off. I cannot make room for rest in my busy schedule. I hate sitting in one place for too long a while anyway,” Mr.Pawar said, reacting to the doctors’ suggestions that he should complete a week-long rest.

Mr.Pawar later tweeted the news of his “good health”, expressing his gratitude to people and party activists for their concern.
title: Pawar discharged from hospital
